text:
Hello everyone :wave: , new user here!
We've been using HubSpot for about 6 months, and I've started developing some projects using the new CRM-Developer tools. I have a few questions on a) the sample projects (there seems to be a bug in the iFrame project) and b) passing data to iframes ... I'm not sure if I should post them here, or is the <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools> channel a better place?

Honestly either channel is fine, you can also post it in the crm development community channel <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CRM-Development-Tools-Beta/gh-p/crm-development-tools-beta> What exactly are your questions?
And the bug is in this file? <https://github.com/HubSpot/ui-extensions-examples/blob/main/display-iframe/src/app/app.functions/crm-card.js>
Anybody else experiencing HubSpot not auto generating and serving .webp images anymore? Getting dinged by Google PageSpeed Insights about not using next gen image formats.

Hello,

Is there any way/workaround to restrict association for certain users?

Our scenario is associations between objects are set automatically, and we don't want internal users to be able to remove/add associations.
You could restrict edit access, but that would be for editing everything about the contact
Hi. Not sure the bug is in the file itself  but yeah: when I generate the project, the iFrame works ok, but the title of the modal is an error message. Something about a missing action.
Another way you could do it is by remove the object type from the associations side bar

Hi! Is it possible to customize the Quote template to the point we can use checkboxes for the quoted items so that the buyer can choose which items they want to purchase? In addition to that, would be possible to use payment links to collect payments only for the chosen items?

I'm looking to put together information about Contacts created in HubSpot based on the user interacting with a marketing campaign. I've been looking at `hs_analytics_first_url`, which appeared to be the first URL the user visited. My understanding was that this column would only ever be set once for a Contact, but looking at the property history I can see it's set multiple times for some contacts. Can someone help me understand why this would be set multiple times? Is it based on multiple Contacts being merged? Is there something else I should be looking at to get granular data to try and associate marketing campaign clicks with Contacts that eventually convert into paying customers?

<@UATE4ATHP> did you ever find a rhyme or reason to this? I see the functionality on <http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com> for example is working... aka you can see an image as a png or jpg in the source code but when you go to save as it comes up as a .webp as expected
<@U24GZQ3GF> yeah I have the same thing on most sites. only way I can tell if it is a .webp is to save it. no idea why

Feel free to remove post if it seem pushy/irrelevant. One of my friend works here and planting a tree for every registration seemed like nice initiative. HubSpot works in removing friction, hence reshared :)
That's really cool

Every signup here is my contribution for greener future :joy::sweat_smile: 
(p.s. i’ve never planted a tree by myself tbh)

Hi Has anyone seen or created any use cases for running calculations within custom coded workflows? A client is looking to leverage custom code to run a lookup on a CO + deal record and calculate a cost.. Any help would be appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:
If you give a little more info on the flow I could help you out with the custom coded action
Ok Ty, I am requesting this info and will follow up asap!

Hey guys. Does anyone know how HubSpot takes care of XSS?  Like for example, <https://blog.HubSpot.com/website/cross-site-scripting|this article> talks about XSS but not about what HubSpot does to prevent it.
<@U041G7D9MNY>
you can prevent it by turning the settings on in the Domain settings
there are also other security settings that you  can / should turn on.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/ssl-and-domain-security-in-HubSpot>
so ” but not about what HubSpot does to prevent it.” - is not correct!
